synopsis: Karin is almost having a regular day at school, but then a new transfer student comes to her school. When Karin finds her new victim and injects her blood into her victim's body, and Kenta sees the whole thing! The next day at school, Karin and Kenta talk, Kenta possibly finds out her secret and Karin has a huge nosebleed...
Karin learns that she has a "normal" vampire's trait. She has a preference in blood.
Karin tries to figure out what happiness is.
Karin decides that she needs to keep Usui happy, so she can maintain apathy for blood. She thinks the best way to do this is make him lunches.
Usui discovers that Karin is a vampire. What will her family do about it?

Usui works every day at the restaurant to the point of exhaustion, making him really unhappy. With Karin's "taste" being unhappiness it makes it impossible for Karin to be around him without overflowing.
To add to Karin's problems, there is a new, loud mouth, transfer student who claims to be from a long generation of vampire hunters. Will he find out about Karin?!
Karin has an "accident" in the hallway. The hunter suspects Usui of being a vampire when the blood is found. How will Karin and Usui cover this up?
We get to see Anju and Karin's relationship. Anju has flashbacks of her childhood with Karin.
Karin fails a test, so Usui tutors her. Karin's dad plays the over-protective dad, and embarrasses Karin by following them around.

title.jp: It's the Summer! It's the Pool! It's Embarrassing

synopsis: Winner invites Karin to a pool, so Karin decides to act really rude to him. Will her plan to be "unattractive" change Winner's views of her?

title.jp: My Big Brother Sure is Embarrassing

synopsis: Ren sets his sights on sucking Usui's mother's blood.
After trying to bite Usui, Karin feels like she betrayed him, and thinks that he hates her. Meanwhile, Ren is still after Usui's mom.

title.jp: Just the Two of us Til Morning is Embarrassing

synopsis: Karin finally realizes her feelings for Usui. Maki stays over at Karin's house for the first time. How will the family react?!
The cultural festival is coming up, but it's not all fun and games for Karin. New problems arise when her gradma(who looks 16 years old) awakens from her coffen.
Elda is after Usui. We see Elda's past, and why she is so against human and vampires relationships.
Everybody is having fun at the cutural festival, except Karin who is worried about Usui getting his blood sucked by Elda. If Elda gets her way, all of Usui's feelings of love will be erased!
When Ren was 14, he was placed in a human all boys school, and had a roomate who got picked on a lot because of his girl characteristics. Just another worthless human to Ren, or was he?

title.jp: Christmas Eve Together is So Embarrassing

synopsis: It's Christmas time. Karin tries to figure out the perfect gift for Usui, and if she should tell him her feelings.

title.jp: This is the First ... It's Embarrassing

synopsis: Usui asks Karin on a date, ans she's estatic. Meanwhile Anju is becoming a vampire, and Maki is depressed over Winner- yet Karin is oblivious to both's unhappiness.

title.jp: What Should I Do, This is Embarrassing

synopsis: Elda has discovered a way to make Karin a true vampire. What will Karin do? Will she choose to become a real one and be with her family. Or will she choose to stay a blood-maker and stay with Usui?

title.jp: Being Like a Lost Child is So Embarrassing

synopsis: Karin doesn't know where to go, so she wonders around aimlessly. The battle between Elda and The Vampire Hunter contines. Usui tries to reach Karin, but can't.
Usui tells Karin to go be with her family, and Karin learns just how much her parents care.

title.jp: It's Embarrassing to be Together Always

synopsis: The final episode in Karin. Will Karin become a normal vampire? Will her family be able to escape the wrath of the vampire hunter? Will it be a happy ending?! Watch it to find out!
